Guardian.definition: one who has or is entitled or legally appointed to the care and management of the person or property of another compare committee

guardian ad li·tem.definition: [-ad-lī-təm, -Ä d-lē-tem]a guardian appointed by a court to represent in a particular lawsuit the interests of a minor, a person not yet born, or a person judged incompetent

natural guardian.definition: a guardian by natural relationship having custody of the person but not the property of a minor
natural guardian.note: Under common law the father is considered the natural guardian of a child until his death or incapacitation, whereupon the mother becomes the natural guardian. Many states have passed statutes giving both parents equal rights as guardians.

statutory guardian.definition: a guardian appointed by statutory authority

testamentary guardian.definition: a person named in a will to serve as a guardian
